page.title: 08The Old Rectory,Ipsley.
page.content: Part of the{Old Rectory Hotel,Ipsley, dates back to the 11th century and is reputed to have been mentioned in the{ {Domesday Book.}It is believed that the hotel was once 'Ipsley Court due to it's{dovcote}which only the{lord of {the manor}was allowed to possess.The house then fell into the hands of the Church for many years,being used as a{ {monastery }(the ghost of one of the monks is still believed to be in residence!)and then as a{rectory. During the persecution of the Roman Catholics in the 16th century a{ {priest's hole}was built. The house has now been turned into a hotel.There are{7 guest rooms}and most of the guests are{businessmen.}It would appear that despite many attractions within an hours drive Redditch is{not popular as a tourist {base. }
